latestVersion.termsOfUse: All data uploaded to this Dataverse are licensed under the CC0 licence. Please follow this link for further information: http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/

authorAffiliation.value: University College London and Birkbeck College, London

dsDescriptionValue.value: This dataset comprises the results of a short public survey on attitudes to reburial of human remains uncovered by archaeological excavations, conducted in New Zealand in 2006. The survey was based upon one that had been carried out in the United Kingdom in 2005, and indicates a clear contrast in public opinion in the two countries. The survey results have been analysed in a masters dissertation on human remains repatriation to New Zealand, which was subsequently published in shorter form in the journal Public Archaeology.

publicationCitation.value: This data will be described in full in a paper in the Journal of Open Archaeology Data (paper currently under review)

files.description: The survey questionnaire form used for the study, with numbered questions, in MicrosoftWord docx format
files.label: survey_form.docx

files.description: The survey results are listed for each question. Coding notes (column B) explain how responses have been recorded. Column GU gives a sum total of the responses, and Column GV gives a percentage total of the responses. This file is in CSV format.
files.label: survey_results.csv
